Class Task

java.lang.Object
taskmanagement.domain.Task
All Implemented Interfaces:
ITask
public class Task extends Object implements ITask
Immutable-identity Task entity (id) with validated fields and a behavioral state (State pattern via TaskState enum).

Notes:

  • Constructors call setters to reuse validation.
  • setState validates non-null only (keeps backward compatibility).
  • State-pattern helpers transitionTo(TaskState) and advanceState() enforce legal transitions.

  • Constructor Details

    • Task

      public Task(int id, String title, String description, TaskState state)
      Creates a task with all fields. Setters perform validation.
      Parameters:
      id - task id (>= 0 recommended; DAO may assign)
      title - non-empty title
      description - nullable description
      state - non-null state
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if title is blank or state is null

    • Task

      public Task(Task other)
      Copy constructor.

  • Method Details

    • getId

      public int getId()
      Specified by:
      getId in interface ITask

    • setId

      public void setId(int id)
      Sets the identifier.

      Note: negative ids are allowed only if your DAO uses them as placeholders. If not, keep ids >= 0.

    • getTitle

      public String getTitle()
      Specified by:
      getTitle in interface ITask

    • setTitle

      public void setTitle(String title)
      Sets a non-blank title.

    • getDescription

      public String getDescription()
      Specified by:
      getDescription in interface ITask

    • setDescription

      public void setDescription(String description)
      Sets description (nullable). Trims when non-null.

    • getState

      public TaskState getState()
      Specified by:
      getState in interface ITask

    • setState

      public void setState(TaskState state)
      Sets state (non-null). Does not enforce transition rules to preserve backward compatibility with existing DAO/VM flows that directly set a state.

    • transitionTo

      public void transitionTo(TaskState target) throws ValidationException
      State-pattern helper: transition to target only if allowed by current state's rules.
      Parameters:
      target - desired target state
      Throws:
      ValidationException - if transition is not allowed
      NullPointerException - if target is null

    • advanceState

      public void advanceState() throws ValidationException
      State-pattern helper: advance to the next state according to the current state's behavior.
      Throws:
      ValidationException - if advancing is not allowed (shouldn't happen with current rules)
